intro: Chorispora iberica, commonly known as the Iberian chorispora, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and Mediterranean regions. It has small, trifoliate leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Chorispora iberica is an important species in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological balance.
